clinical_study.brief_title: Recovery of Respiratory System in COVID-19 Patients
clinical_study.official_title: Tracking the Recovery of Respiratory Physiology in COVID-19 Patients a Pilot Study

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this study is to determine the effects of the clinical course of treatment as well as long-term symptoms of COVID-19 on respiratory function, exercise capacity, and quality of life.

primary_outcome.measure: Change in diffusion capacity of the lungs
primary_outcome.time_frame: through study completion, an average of 5 months
primary_outcome.description: change in diffusing capacity of the lungs for carbon monoxide and its components

primary_outcome.time_frame: through study completion, an average of 5 months
primary_outcome.description: CT assessment of airway diameter and thickness

primary_outcome.time_frame: through study completion, an average of 5 months
primary_outcome.description: Measurement of basic lung function using forced vital capacity (FVC), slow vital capacity (SVC), forced expiratory volume at one second (FEV1), maximal inspiratory pressure (MIPS), maximal expiratory pressure (MEPS), exhaled nitric oxide (ExNO), forced oscillation technique (FOT), overnight pulse oximetry

primary_outcome.time_frame: through study completion, an average of 5 months
primary_outcome.description: Change in examine post exertional malaise

primary_outcome.time_frame: through study completion, an average of 5 months
primary_outcome.description: Evaluation of change in performance on maximal exercise test over two days to identify presence of post-exertional malaise

primary_outcome.time_frame: through study completion, an average of 5 months
primary_outcome.description: St. George's respiratory Questionnaire scoring of pulmonary symptoms. Scores range from 0 to 100, with higher scores indicating more limitations.

primary_outcome.time_frame: through study completion, an average of 5 months
primary_outcome.description: SF-36 questionnaire assessment of physical and mental health. Two scores one for physical functioning and one for mental functioning. Scores range from 0-100 with a higher score indicating better health

arm_group.description: Individuals that have been diagnosed with COVID19 and continue to have lingering symptoms associated with COVID19
Individuals that have been diagnosed with COVID19 and do not have lingering symptoms that are associated with COVID19

study_pop.textblock: Male and female participants that have tested positive for COVID-19 within 28 or more days will be recruited for this study. Individuals with or without continuing symptoms of COVID-19 can participate.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Have a documented positive qRT-PCR for SARS-CoV-2 confirming prior COVID-19 diagnosis within the last 28 days
- At least 18 years of age.
- Female subjects must not be pregnant or trying to become pregnant during the duration of study participation.
- No known plans to move out of the state, or become unable to return to one of the Mayo Clinic sites for follow-up testing.
- Must be able to provide clear informed written consent.
Exclusion Criteria:
- Individuals with pacemakers or other implantable devices that will make interpreting a CT scan challenging.
- Individuals with major limitations to exercise.
